title: Rory: Being Bryson's best mate not Masters focus
content: LIV Golf League captain Bryson DeChambeau hopes he gets another chance to play with PGA Tour star Rory McIlroy in the final round of this week's PGA Championship at Quail Hollow Club.

title: Mitchell can't believe Cavs' exit: 'Let city down'
content: Donovan Mitchell promised that the Cavaliers will return better after saying the team let the city down with a disappointing exit following a magical season.

title: Angel City's King has heart surgery after collapsing
content: Angel City defender Savy King was recovering from heart surgery following her collapse on the field during a National Women's Soccer League match on Friday night.

title: Sasaki latest Dodger to IL; no timeline for return
content: Touted Dodgers rookie Roki Sasaki landed on the injured list Tuesday with right shoulder impingement, an injury similar to one he had in Japan last year.

title: Pacers pen winning 'script,' return to East finals
content: The Pacers are returning to the Eastern Conference finals after a 114-105 victory over the Cavaliers in Game 5.

title: 'We had no choice': Thunder storm back to take G5
content: Led by Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's 31 points, the Thunder overcame a 44-point, 15-rebound night from Denver's Nikola Jokic to go up 3-2 in the Western Conference semifinals.

title: Sun exploring new investment, possible sale
content: Connecticut Sun president Jennifer Rizzotti said Tuesday that the team's ownership group is "exploring all options to strategically invest in the team," including a potential sale.

title: ⛳ PGA Championship: Experts' picks and more
content: Who will win? Who has the best betting value? What props are the most interesting? Our experts look at the 2025 PGA Championship from all angles.

title: Wait, why didn't my NFL team ____? Graziano makes sense of 10 lingering offseason questions
content: Let's reason on why the Bears didn't improve at RB, why the Steelers didn't plan better at QB and why the Bengals didn't extend Trey Hendrickson (yet).

title: How the Warriors get Steph to a Game 6, and more NBA playoff keys﻿
content: Two of the past three champs are staring at elimination without their superstars, plus more Round 2 revelations.

title: How Anthony Edwards' hero-ball evolution began with Kobe and Michael Jordan
content: Edwards has become a star in crunch time by learning when to make the right play -- or be the right play himself.

title: Back for more: What will Clark, Reese and 2024 WNBA rookie class do for an encore?
content: The 2024 WNBA rookies had a historic impact. What should we expect from the likes of Angel Reese and Caitlin Clark in Year 2?

title: Rested, recharged, stronger than ever: How Fever's Caitlin Clark used offseason to reset
content: When cameras weren't catching her hanging with Taylor Swift, Caitlin Clark honed her game on the court and in the weight room.

title: 'The head of the snake': How Chris Tanev personifies the Leafs' new-attitude defense
content: Toronto has always been capable of outscoring teams. With Tanev leading the way, their D can now stop anyone.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Knights on the brink, critical Game 5 in Panthers-Leafs
content: Can Edmonton eliminate Vegas? And who earns win No. 3 between Toronto and Florida? Wednesday previews here.

title: Updated 2025 MLB draft rankings: Top 150 prospects -- and a mini-mock draft
content: The race for the No. 1 overall pick is wide open. Here's who your team could be targeting this summer.

title: How Alex Bregman is adjusting to life in a new clubhouse
content: The longtime face of the Astros is now tearing it up for the Red Sox -- while his future remains uncertain.

title: Tier rankings: From Scottie and Rory to just happy to make the cut
content: Can Rory McIlroy win his second major of the year? Which LIV golfers can contend? We break down the field.

title: Grading how every Big Ten men's basketball team performed in 2024-25
content: Rutgers' star duo fell short of expectations while Wisconsin's John Tonje helped the Badgers surpass theirs.

title: Premier League Rookie of the Year: Ranking the best new U19 players
content: The Premier League Rookie of the Year award doesn't exist, but it should. Here are the young players who would be in the running for the 2024-25 prize.

title: Onside/Offside: Barça impress, Man United and Tottenham underwhelm
content: What teams showed the best and the worst of the 2024-25 European season? Luis Miguel Echegaray talks about all of that in his latest Onside/Offside column.

title: Sources: Amorim to pay for staff to attend UEL final
content: Amorim has paid for 30 of his Manchester United backroom staff to take their families to next week's Europa League final in Bilbao, Spain

title: Sources: Forest's Awoniyi placed in induced coma
content: Nottingham Forest striker Taiwo Awoniyi has been placed in an induced coma after undergoing "urgent" surgery on an abdominal injury, sources told ESPN.

title: Last-gasp goal puts Sunderland in promotion final
content: Sunderland will face Sheffield United in the Championship playoff final after Daniel Ballard's header in the final seconds of extra time snatched a 1-1 home draw against Coventry City on Tuesday to secure a 3-2 aggregate victory.

title: Ex-Marshall star helps Sevilla in relegation battle
content: Álvaro García Pascual, who last year was playing college soccer in the United States, gave Sevilla a 1-0 home win over Las Palmas and moved the traditional Spanish club on the verge of escaping relegation in the Spanish league on Tuesday.

title: Ancelotti on Madrid exit, Brazil deal: 'No drama'
content: Carlo Ancelotti said there's "no need for drama" around his departure from Real Madrid, insisting he remains "totally focused" but admitting the team might need "fresh impetus" after confirming that he'll leave to take charge of Brazil.

title: Op Sindoor: How IAF bypassed Pak's China-supplied defence systems, hit military targets
content: Government revealed details of Operation Sindoor. Indian Air Force bypassed Chinese defence systems. They destroyed Pakistani military targets. Strikes occurred at Noor Khan and Rahimyar Khan airbases. India used indigenous platforms. Pakistan's attacks involved Chinese missiles and Turkish drones. Indian air defence systems neutralised these threats. Made-in-India technologies proved successful. Wreckage of foreign weapons was recovered.

title: As Pakistan launched drones, its allies fired cyber missiles at India
content: During Operation Sindoor, India faced significant cyberattacks orchestrated by state-backed hackers and hacktivists from various countries, including Pakistan and China. Critical infrastructure, defense PSUs, and financial platforms were targeted with malware, phishing, and denial-of-service attacks. Apart from defence PSUs and their MSME vendors, critical infrastructure and transportation services also came under attack.

title: Cong plans 'Jai Hind' rallies over PM's silence on Trump's ceasefire claims
content: Congress has raised concerns about the United States' role in the India-Pakistan ceasefire, questioning Prime Minister Modi's silence on the matter. Jairam Ramesh emphasized the party's support for the armed forces in combating terrorism and criticized Modi's absence from all-party meetings. The party also demanded a special Parliament session to discuss the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Why Kohli, Rohit in BCCI contracts' A+ category despite Test exits?
content: BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia confirmed that Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma will remain in the Grade A+ category despite retiring from T20Is and Tests. This decision acknowledges their continued contribution to the Indian cricket team. Kohli retired from Tests after 123 matches, amassing 9,230 runs, while Rohit concluded his Test career with 4,301 runs in 67 matches.

title: Pakistan crumbling? Baloch leader declares independence
content: Baloch leader Mir Yar Baloch asserted that Balochistan was never part of Pakistan, citing decades of alleged atrocities. He urged Indian media to recognize Balochs as distinct from Pakistanis, recalling Balochistan's declaration of independence on August 11, 1947. Amid India-Pakistan tensions, Balochistan expressed support for India, with Baloch claiming backing from 60 million Baloch patriots.

title: Harsh Goenka shares Rs 4000 cr 'blow' Indians can give to Turkey, Azerbaijan
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, billionaire Harsh Goenka called for a boycott of travel to Turkey and Azerbaijan due to their support for Pakistan. Goenka highlighted that Indian tourists contributed significantly to their economies. Several Indian travel companies, including Ixigo and EasyMyTrip, have suspended bookings to these nations in solidarity with India.

title: Kohli retires not just as a central force but India's greatest Test captain
content: Virat Kohli has announced his retirement from Test cricket, marking the end of an iconic era. With 40 Test wins as captain, he leaves as India’s most successful red-ball leader. His passionate leadership and consistent performances, especially at No. 4, transformed Indian cricket. The void left behind is immense — on the scoreboard and in spirit.

title: 'We stand with nation': JNU suspends MoU with Turkey's Inonu University
content: Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) has indefinitely suspended its academic Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Turkey's Inonu University, citing national security concerns. This decision follows nationwide anger towards Turkey and Azerbaijan for their perceived support of Pakistan during recent conflicts. The MoU, signed in February 2025, was initially set to expire in February 2028.

title: IPL 2025: 'Shaken' Aussie Fraser-McGurk not to return to India
content: Jake Fraser-McGurk's childhood coach Shanon Young has confirmed to TimesofIndia.com that the 23-year-old is still pretty shaken up after the Dharamsala fixture between Punjab Kings (PBKS) and Delhi Capitals (DC) was halted midway due to security reasons. Punjab Kings are also in a fix about the availability of their Australian contingent.

title: Elon Musk shares dancing videos of Optimus Robot; Tesla responds
content: Elon Musk showcased Tesla's Optimus robot dancing on X, highlighting its real-time movement and balance capabilities. Musk plans to feature an Optimus dance troupe at the upcoming Tesla shareholder meeting. These demonstrations, part of Tesla's AI and robotics efforts, reveal significant progress since the initial prototype in 2022, with limited production planned for 2025.

title: Exclusive: From heatstrokes to breaking records is India's 'Usain Bolt'
content: Animesh Kujur, battling heatstroke and fatigue, defied expectations by setting a new national record of 20.40 seconds in the 200m at the Senior Federation Cup. He also contributed to a new national record in the 4x100m relay. Formerly a football player, Kujur's rise in athletics has been meteoric, fueled by inspiration from Usain Bolt and strong family support.

title: HC orders case against BJP minister over remark on Col Sofiya Qureshi
content: The Madhya Pradesh High Court has mandated the registration of a First Information Report (FIR) against state minister Vijay Shah following his contentious remarks about Colonel Sofiya Qureshi. The army officer was involved in briefing the media on "Operation Sindoor," under which the Indian armed forces targeted terrorists in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: US-China trade: Trump says he called Apple CEO after China tariff rollback and...
content: Following a US-China trade agreement where tariffs are suspended for 90 days, President Trump claimed Apple CEO Tim Cook plans to increase US investments, potentially building more plants. This news follows reports of Apple considering iPhone price hikes, possibly linked to tariffs.

title: TMKOC actor reveals how he bagged role of inspector Chalu Pandey
content: Daya Shankar Pandey, widely known as Inspector Chalu Pandey in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah,' shared how he landed the iconic role. Initially assisting producer Asit Kumarr Modi with ideas, Pandey was offered the part, despite his commitments to 'Shanidev.

title: EXPLAINED: How new IPL player replacement rule will benefit franchises
content: With several Australian players unavailable for the remainder of IPL 2025, the BCCI has permitted franchises to sign temporary replacements who won't be eligible for retention next season. Jake Fraser-McGurk will not participate, and Delhi Capitals have already secured Mustafizur Rahman as his replacement for Rs 6 Crore.

title: Ravindra Jadeja shatters a record no one thought possible
content: Ravindra Jadeja has achieved a historic milestone, maintaining the longest reign as the No. 1 all-rounder in Test cricket history, showcasing his unmatched versatility. Meanwhile, Mehidy Hasan Miraz's outstanding performance against Zimbabwe propelled him to No. 2 in the all-rounder rankings, closing the gap with Jadeja. The rankings also saw movements for other players like Taijul Islam and Jasprit Bumrah.

title: Kohli seen doing naam jaap in Vrindavan with Anushka: Top 5 news
content: Arpita Khan recommended Sneha Ullal for Lucky. Aryan Khan's selfie with 'The Bads of Bollywood' went viral. Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma visited Vrindavan. Armaan Malik addressed rift rumors with Amaal Malik. Samay Raina made his first public appearance after the India's Got Talent row. These entertainment stories are making headlines. The events have stirred conversations across social media platforms.

title: Golden State Warriors face bombshell update on Stephen Curry
content: The Golden State Warriors face elimination in Game 5 against the Minnesota Timberwolves without Stephen Curry, who is sidelined with a hamstring strain. Coach Steve Kerr confirmed Curry's absence, a significant blow as the Warriors trail 3-1. Despite glimpses of playmaking from Kuminga and Podziemski, replicating Curry's impact has been difficult.

title: Op Keller: 'War-like' stores recovered after 3 terrorists killed in J&K
content: Following a fierce encounter in Shopian, J&K, security forces recovered a large cache of arms and ammunition, including AK-series rifles and grenades. The operation, dubbed Operation Keller, neutralized three Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists, including a local commander. This action follows the deadly Pahalgam attack and India's retaliatory strikes on terror launchpads in Pakistan and PoK. Counterinsurgency efforts continue despite a recent ceasefire.

title: 'He brought back my suhag': Wife of released BSF jawan praises PM
content: BSF jawan Purnam Kumar Shaw returned to India after inadvertently crossing into Pakistan while on duty in Punjab. His wife, Rajani Shaw, expressed immense relief and gratitude to the government and PM Modi for his safe return. She also thanked CM Mamata Banerjee and acknowledged the support from state and central authorities, emphasizing the nation's solidarity during the ordeal.

title: Biryani served to gangster Gaja Marne in police van; 5 Pune cops suspended
content: Pune police took action after a video surfaced. The video showed cops serving biryani to gangster Gaja Marne in a police van. This happened while he was being moved to Sangli jail. City police commissioner Amitesh Kumar suspended an assistant inspector and four constables. Marne was arrested earlier for assaulting a software engineer and was booked under MCOCA.

title: Operation Sindoor: How Indian Air Force grounded Pakistan's air power
content: In a swift response to a terror attack, the Indian Air Force executed Operation Sindoor, striking 11 Pakistani military air bases between May 8 and 10. The precision strikes targeted key infrastructure, including drone warfare command centers and aircraft deployment hubs.

title: 'Operation Sindoor exceeded aims, India achieved a massive victory'
content: Operation Sindoor marked a decisive shift in India’s military doctrine, combining precision airstrikes with strategic restraint. West Point expert John Spencer called it an “objective victory,” praising its clarity and execution. India destroyed terrorist infrastructure, neutralized Pakistani counterattacks, and redefined deterrence. The operation set a new red line, signaling India’s resolve against state-backed terror without full-scale war.

title: 'Slapped her until she collapsed': Lawyer beats up woman colleague with mop stick
content: In Vanchiyoor court, a junior woman lawyer, Syamili J V, was brutally attacked by her senior, Beyline Das, during a discussion about an internal office dispute. Das slapped her repeatedly and beat her with a mop stick, causing serious injuries that required hospitalization. The Bar Association suspended Das, and police have registered cases, though he remains at large.

title: Wayne Gretzky son’s Mother’s Day post hides a deeper message about family legacy
content: Ty Gretzky, son of hockey legend Wayne Gretzky, celebrated Mother's Day by honoring his wife, Sara, and his mother, Janet, with heartfelt Instagram posts. He praised Sara as the center of their family, sharing a loving photo with their daughters. Ty also expressed deep gratitude for his mother, Janet, highlighting the strong generational bond within the Gretzky family.

title: Virat Kohli seen doing jaap mala in Vrindavan after his test retirement announcement
content: Following his recent retirement announcement from Test cricket after 14 years, Virat Kohli, accompanied by his wife Anushka Sharma, sought spiritual solace at Shri Premanand Govind Sharan Ji Maharaj’s ashram in Vrindavan. Pictures circulating online show Kohli engaging in 'mala jaap' using a digital device. Anushka Sharma posted a heartfelt message, acknowledging his dedication and evolution throughout his Test career, emphasizing her unwavering support for his decision.

title: Man saves two from burning hot air balloon at Mexican festival, then falls to death
content: In a tragic incident at the First Balloon Festival in Zacatecas, Mexico, Luicio N, a 40-year-old man, died a hero after saving two passengers from a burning hot air balloon. He helped them escape, but became entangled in a rope as the balloon ascended. Despite clinging on, he fell to his death.

title: India blocks Turkey's 'TRT World' and China's 'Global Times' over misinformation
content: India blocked the X account of Turkish broadcaster TRT World after it spread misinformation following precision strikes under Operation Sindoor. The move came as forensic reports linked Turkish-origin drones used by Pakistan in airspace violations. India also blocked Chinese state media accounts for similar reasons, amid rising tensions after a Pakistan-sponsored terror attack killed 26 in Pahalgam.

title: Watch: US rebukes Pak reporter on PM Modi 'didn't welcome ceasefire' remark
content: A Pakistani journalist's attempt to question PM Modi's stance on India-Pakistan de-escalation talks faced a firm response from the US State Department. The journalist suggested former President Trump deserved credit for a ceasefire, a claim Principal Deputy Spokesperson Tommy Pigott addressed by emphasizing the US focus on maintaining the ceasefire and encouraging direct communication between India and Pakistan.

title: NCW condemns derogatory remarks against Col Sufiya Qureshi
content: The National Commission for Women has strongly condemned alleged disrespectful remarks against Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, emphasizing the need to respect women in uniform. Chairperson Vijaya Rahatkar criticized Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shah's controversial comments, which sparked public outrage. Shah's remarks, referencing Qureshi's role in Operation Sindoor, were deemed derogatory and an insult to women serving the nation.

title: 'Didn't experience joy of having son': BJP leader Dilip Ghosh’s stepson found dead
content: Srinjoy Dasgupta, stepson of BJP leader Dilip Ghosh, was found dead at his New Town home after a party. Family cited a neurological disorder and medication, while a preliminary report suggests pancreatic hemorrhage. Police are investigating the circumstances, including possible drug overdose or poisoning, noting scratch marks and recording statements from friends present at the flat.

title: Germany bans far-right 'Kingdom of Germany' group
content: German authorities have arrested Peter Fitzek, founder of the 'Kingdom of Germany,' along with three other leaders. This group, part of the Reich Citizens movement, rejects the legitimacy of the German republic. Interior Minister Alexander Dobrindt banned the group, accusing it of establishing a 'counter-state' with criminal economic structures and antisemitic narratives.

title: India’s defence exports surge to Rs 23,622 cr; 34-fold increase from 2013-14
content: India's defence exports have surged to a record Rs 23,622 crore in FY 2024-25, marking a 12.04% increase. This boost reflects a 34-fold rise since FY 2013-14. The success of 'Make in India' weapon system has been highlighted by Operation Sindoor.

title: 'Raping, sedating and taking photos of you for years': UK woman's husband confesses
content: Kate, a UK woman, bravely shared her horrific experience of being drugged and raped by her husband, who also took photographs of the assaults. Despite initial setbacks, including the CPS's initial decision not to press charges and her own withdrawal of the case, she persevered.

title: From Article 370 to demonetisation, new CJI BR Gavai behind landmark verdicts
content: Justice Bhushan Ramkrishna Gavai has been sworn in as the 52nd Chief Justice of India, succeeding Justice Sanjiv Khanna. Known for his significant judgments on constitutional rights, free speech, and environmental protection, Justice Gavai was part of key decisions, including upholding the revocation of Article 370 and striking down the electoral bonds scheme.

title: Bombs hurled at Patna college after clash between 2 student groups
content: Chaos erupted at B N College in Patna when crude bombs exploded during a Certified Internal Auditor examination, severely injuring a student. The blasts, stemming from a prior dispute between student groups, triggered protests against alleged administrative apathy. Police are investigating, reviewing CCTV footage, and a forensic team is collecting samples.

title: Alyssa Healy identifies 'scariest' part of PBKS vs DC suspension
content: Alyssa Healy, Australian women's cricket captain, recounted the unsettling atmosphere during the Punjab Kings-Delhi Capitals match in Dharamsala, which was briefly disrupted due to security concerns. Healy highlighted the anxiety among Australian players, fuelled by misinformation and uncertainty surrounding the situation.

title: Uruguay's Jose Mujica: The world's humblest head of state
content: Jose "Pepe" Mujica, Uruguay's former president, was celebrated for his humble lifestyle and progressive policies, including legalizing gay marriage and abortion. A former guerrilla, he donated most of his salary and lived on a farm, embodying his belief that happiness lies in contentment, not material wealth.

title: Pakistan gets $1,023 mn from IMF under extended fund facility
content: Pakistan has received a $1.023 billion installment from the IMF's Extended Fund Facility, to be added to its foreign exchange reserves. India had earlier abstained from the vote, voicing concerns about Pakistan's history of non-compliance with IMF conditions and the potential use of funds for cross-border terrorism.

title: Bihar Woman, 40, Poisons Her 4 Children, Attempts Suicide: Police
content: A 40-year-old woman in Bihar's Aurangabad district on Wednesday allegedly poisoned her four children, before attempting suicide, leading to the death of her three daughters, officials said.

title: "Exceptional Synergy": How Homegrown Systems Propelled Op Sindoor Success
content: Operation Sindoor's tactical brilliance showed India can strike at the heart of terror anywhere in Pakistan. What stood out was the seamless integration of indigenous hi-tech systems into national defence.

title: Explained: The Snakes And Ladders Of A Possible Ukrainian Peace Deal
content: Russia and Ukraine say they want to talk about peace so what are the contours of any potential peace deal - and what are the dangers?

title: NASA Fires Employee After Post On Her Article Take Down Goes Viral
content: NASA has sacked an employee of Caribbean origin in compliance with Donald Trump's executive order to "terminate" all persons employed under the Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion initiative.

title: "Gave Food To Homeless": Delhi Cop Gets Tearful Farewell After Transfer
content: A Delhi policeman, who recently got transferred, received a grand and an emotional farewell from local residents, who poured out onto the streets to felicitate their "family member".

title: Opinion: Opinion | Six Big - But Less Noticed - Takeaways From Operation Sindoor
content: Though the S-400 system hogged media limelight, it was the indigenous radars, SAM and Counter Unmanned Aerial Systems that formed the backbone of our ground-based air defence, highlighting the value of indigenous armament.

title: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE: JNU Suspends Pact With Turkey University, Cites "National Security"
content: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi chaired a meeting of the Cabinet Committee on Security on Wednesday, the first since the pause in hostilities between India and Pakistan.

title: "Cannot Do Everything": WHO Halves Management Team After US Funding Cuts
content: The World Health Organization has reduced its management team by half and will have to scale back operations, its director-general said on Wednesday, four months after the United States announced it was leaving the agency and cutting funding.

title: Trump Says He's Open To Attending Talks On Ukraine, Unsure About Putin
content: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday said he was still considering whether to attend talks on the war in Ukraine planned for Thursday in Turkey but he does not know whether Russian President Vladimir Putin will go.

title: Protests In Turkey, 'Global Statesman' Abroad: Erdogan's 'Parallel Universes'
content: Turkey's President Tayyip Erdogan has probably never held more global sway: he will host the first direct RussiaUkraine peace talks in three years on Thursday,

title: China Slams US-UK Trade Deal, Calls It 'Poison Pills' Worse Than Tariffs
content: These conditions have raised concerns in Beijing, with Zhang Yansheng, a senior researcher at the China Academy of Macroeconomic Research, describing the deal's clauses as "poison pills" that are worse than tariffs.

title: US Official Silences Reporter Who Accused India Of Blocking Ceasefire
content: A reporter faced a humiliating moment when the United States shut him down for accusing Prime Minister Narendra Modi of opposing the de-escalation talks between Delhi and Islamabad.

title: Why Many Indian Tourists Are Cancelling Trips To Turkey, Azerbaijan
content: Hundreds of Indian tourists are now cancelling their trips to Turkey and Azerbaijan as these countries supported Pakistan in the conflict with India following the massacre of 26 tourists in Kashmir's Pahalgam by Islamabad-backed terrorists.

title: Ex-Chief Of Chinese Chip Giant Gets Suspended Death Sentence For Corruption
content: China on Wednesday handed a suspended death sentence to the former head of a major state-owned maker of high-end semiconductors, state media reported.

title: As Young, "Jeans-Wearing" Priest In Peru, Pope Leo XIV Survived Bomb Threat
content: Hector Camacho remembers Prevost asking altar boys for help with words in Spanish, taking them on trips to beaches, and hiring karate, swimming and basketball coaches to keep the town's youth away from crime.

title: Committed To Eliminating Maoism By March 31, 2026: CRPF Chief GP Singh
content: Security forces are undertaking "relentless and ruthless" operations to ensure that Naxalism is eliminated by March 31, 2026, Director General Central Reserve Police Force GP Singh said Wednesday.

title: Reform Deal Reached, Bangladesh Says It Will Receive $1.3 Billion From IMF
content: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) is set to release $1.3 billion to Bangladesh in June, after completing a fourth review of its $4.7-billion loan programme and a key breakthrough in talks on exchange rate reforms, the finance ministry said.

title: Cabinet Clears ₹3,706 Crore HCL-Foxconn Chip Plant In UP's Jewar
content: The Union Cabinet on Wednesday approved a Rs 3,706 crore semiconductor plant at Jewar in Uttar Pradesh, to be set up by the HCL-Foxconn joint venture to manufacture display driver chips for mobile phones, laptops, and automobiles.

title: Explained: India's Trade Ties With Turkey And Azerbaijan Amid Pak Conflict
content: India's trade relations with Turkey and Azerbaijan are expected to come under strain due to Ankara and Baku backing Islamabad and condemning India's recent strikes on terror camps in Pakistan.

title: Brazil recalls Marta, 39, despite 2024 retirement
content: Brazil's all-time leading scorer Marta has been recalled to the squad for the first time since last year's Olympic final for a pair of friendlies against Japan, coach Arthur Elias announced on Tuesday when naming the 39-year-old.

title: USMNT to face Korea, Japan in Sept. friendlies
content: The U.S. men's national team will take on South Korea and Japan in a pair of friendlies in September, the U.S. Soccer Federation announced on Tuesday.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo's son makes Portugal U15 debut
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's eldest son, Cristiano Ronaldo Júnior, made his debut for Portugal under-15s on Tuesday in a 4-1 win against Japan.

title: No school, no field ... and for some, no home: How the Palisades Dolphins rose from the ashes
content: The California wildfires shook their lives. Now, as a chaotic -- but much-needed -- baseball season concludes, the future of their team is in doubt.

title: 2025 NFL schedule analysis: Projections, odds, players to upgrade and downgrade
content: The friendliest and toughest slates in fantasy, who makes the NFL playoffs and the race for the No. 1 pick in 2026.

title: Unexpected statistical trends to exploit going forward
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft examines unexpected statistical anomalies from the first quarter of the 2025 season.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Stars favored to win Cup after decisive Game 4 win
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye Hudson-Odoi, Semenyo
content: Nottingham Forest's Callum Hudson-Odoi and Bournemouth's Antoine Semenyo are on Manchester United's radar. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Transfer portal final ranking: College football's 100 best players on the move
content: more than 3,400 FBS scholarship players entered the NCAA transfer portal this offseason . the first window lasted from Dec. 9 to Dec. 28 and the second went from April 16 to April 25 . which players ended up being the most coveted on the open market?

title: What's next for Jayson Tatum and the Celtics following his Achilles injury?
content: the "Get Up" crew discusses if Jayson Tatum's injury derails Boston's championship hopes . he suffered a rupture of his Achilles tendon late in the fourth quarter . the ramifications start with the ability to come back from a 3-1 deficit .

title: 10 moves that shaped the WNBA offseason -- and what they mean for 2025
content: the 2025 WNBA season tips off later this week, but first, let's look at how we got here . the golden state Valkyries join the league as the first expansion franchise since 2008 . three no. 1 picks who had spent the entirety of their careers with the franchises that drafted them .

title: 'My face, my rules': How FSU's Michaela Edenfield made makeup her competitive advantage
content: Michaela Edenfield is an artist at work, recording and sharing "get ready with me" videos . the 6-foot-1 redshirt senior is FSU's starting catcher . "it's the mental preparation behind closed doors," she says .

title: NBA playoff futures: Thunder move to odds-on championship favorite
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder are the odds-on favorite to win the 2025 NBA Championship . the Thunder moved to -105 win the Finals with the New York Knicks jumping from 18-1 to the second-shortest favorite at +500 .

title: Will Harrison Jr. break out? Can McConkey be a No. 1? 2nd-year WR questions
content: the 2025 draft class is focusing on the wide receivers . it's a great group for many fans . there's one question for 13 second-year receivers, based on rookie usage and output . london's marvin Harrison has the most to prove among first-year wide receiver .

title: If Flick can make Barcelona more boring, they'll become unstoppable
content: real madrid beat laliga 3:02 on tuesday night . a total of 25 goals and two trophies were sealed . the UEFA champions league semifinal was a success . it was the final of the laLiga .

title: The lesson of Pete Rose and 'Shoeless' Joe? History is messy
content: if long overdue, reversal of policy, first reported by ESPN's Don Van Natta Jr. . manfred lifted bans on all deceased players, including Pete Rose and "Shoeless" Joe Jackson . most died decades ago and were on the list for gambling-related offenses .

title: Let's feast: Cowboys host Chiefs on Thanksgiving
content: Stephen A. Smith explains why the George Pickens trade doesn't move the Cowboys up in the NFC East. (1:46) The  Dallas Cowboys  will welcome in the  Kansas City Chiefs  for their traditional Thanksgiving Day home game. CBS announced Wednesday morning that the Cowboys will face the Chiefs on Nov. 27 with a 4:30 p.m. ET kickoff. This marks the second announced game for each team for the 2025 season. The Cowboys  will travel to face  the  Philadelphia Eagles  in the NFL regular-season opener Sept. 4, and the Chiefs have  another holiday game  when they host the  Denver Broncos  on Christmas night. The Cowboys and Chiefs last squared off in November 2021, with Kansas City winning 19-9 after shutting down quarterback  Dak Prescott  and a Dallas offense that ranked first in the league entering the game. The Chiefs will play on Thanksgiving Day for the first time since 2006. The full NFL schedule will be announced Wednesday at 8 p.m. ET, with a schedule release special airing on ESPN2.

title: 47-Million-Year-Old Cicada Fossil Discovered, Is Full Of Detail
content: a 47-million-year-old cicada fossil has been discovered . it is so detailed that even the veins in its wings are clearly visible . scientists believe their shape and features belong to a group where the males could sing .

title: NBA playoff takeaways: Thunder lead series vs. Nuggets
content: no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers beat Cleveland Cavaliers 2-0 in the Eastern and Western Conference semifinals . the no. 3 new york Knicks took control of their series with the No. 2 seed Boston Celtics with a crucial Game 4 win . in the West, the Oklahoma City Thunder took a 3-1 series lead in Game 5 against the Denver Nuggets behind Shai Gilgeous .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Miami makes move after landing five-star OT
content: the recruiting trail is starting to heat up, in anticipation of being set ablaze in June . several five-stars have come off the board recently, including two of the top linemen in the nation . former Miami offensive lineman and current hurricanes coach Mario Cristobal scored a key win in the trenches for his Hurricanes .

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: Who landed in top five, Della Maddalena or Silva?
content: Della Maddalena beats belal Muhammad in the pound-for-pound rankings . the other fighter who earned a spot landed in an even more coveted position in the top 10 . Natalia Silva beat former women's flyweight champion Alexa Grasso . Valentina Shevchenko garnered added support from the voting panel .

title: Andrew Painter and other prospects on the rise
content: the Philadelphia Phillies have one of the top pitching rotations in the major leagues . they haven't seen much of painter in actual games . the 22-year-old is a 2021 first-round pick .

title: PM SHRI Kendriya Vidyalaya Sattenapalli shines with 100 per cent pass rate in Class X exams
content: J. Yashwant emerges school topper with 95.8 per cent, followed by Tapan Chowdhary at 91 per cent and Pritam Sai Narayan Naik (90 per cent)

title: CBSE results: Hubballi-Dharwad Schools fare well; KV-1 records 100% results
content: Private schools and Kendriya Vidyalays in Hubballi Dharwad region have recorded good results with some even recording 100% passing percentage in the CBSE Class X and XII examinations, the results of which were announced on Tuesday (May 13).

title: Make water smart farming a priority, says IARI Director; 38th annual convocation of UAS-D held
content: Director and Vice Chancellor of ICAR- Indian Agricultural Research Institute (IARI), New Delhi, Ch. Srinivasa Rao has emphasised the need for making water smart farming a priority.

title: Catering unit found serving food to Railways sealed after health officials seize stale food from kitchen
content: Health wing of the Kochi Corporation raids catering unit at Kadavanthra, finds large quantities of stale food and kitchen in unhygienic condition

title: Lokesh calls for grand conduct of Mahanadu in Kadapa from May 27
content: Ensure the event is successful by delegating responsibilities to Ministers and senior leaders, he tells organising committee leaders

title: High-level probe ordered into Bevco godown fire
content: Preliminary estimates place damages worth over ₹10 crore, with more than 45,000 cases of liquor destroyed. Excise Minister M.B. Rajesh visits the site in Pulikeezh, near Thiruvalla on Wednesday evening

title: Get ready for kharif 2025: Anantapur Collector to officials
content: V. Vinod Kumar holds review meeting, seeks detailed action plan of groundnut seed distribution and progress of drone deployment; calls for expediting compensation disbursement to farmers affected by climatic changes

title: Munnar panchayat secretary transferred
content: Citing rule violation in receiving the resignation letter of the former Munnar panchayat president Deepa Rajkumar

title: India-Pakistan tension: JNU suspends MoU with Turkish Inonu University
content: The MoU was inked on February 3 for a period of three years; decision comes against the backdrop of tensions between India and Pakistan

title: Cholera scare in Thalavady triggers emergency response
content: Panchayat to conduct ward-level awareness and sanitation drives. Authorities also to collect water samples for testing

title: 31 Maoists killed in 21-day action at Karregutta hills: CRPF DG
content: Amit Shah lauds major success for anti-Maoist operations; CRPF and Chhattisgarh Police aim to end Maoist violence by 2026

title: Two from Assam arrested in alleged sex racket case
content: The alleged racket was exposed when the 17-year-old girl, who claimed to have been locked up and forced into prostitution, escaped and sought refuge at the Medical College police station

title: ‘Ente Keralam’ expo at Kanakakkunnu from May 17
content: KIIFB has readied a 75,000 sq. ft. pavilion, 50,000 sq. ft. of which is air-conditioned, and  housing 250 stalls for the event

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu launches vaccine for lumpy skin disease in animals
content: He calls for effective rollout of the vaccine, which has been developed by Biovet, a subsidiary of Bharat Biotech

title: Prenatal sex-determination racket busted in Chittoor, five held
content: The sting operation was done based on reliable information received from officials in Tamil Nadu; victims are currently being questioned

title: Thrikkakara municipal chairperson dismisses audit report putting question mark over council
content: The Opposition parties had called for a special council meeting to discuss the report, which noted that ₹7.5 crore, which the civic body had received on various occasions, were not accounted for

title: Women hold just 33% of entry-level roles in private jobs in India: Report
content: McKinsey report reveals gender gap in Indian workforce, with women under-represented in entry-level and managerial roles

title: Kerala slumps to 12th slot in organ pledging in the country
content: Maharashtra has the highest number of registrations (51,538), followed by Rajasthan (43,602), and Karnataka (37,412). Of the 14 districts in Kerala, Thiruvananthapuram (1,408) has the highest number of people pledging their organs, and Ernakulam (641) and Kollam (593) are in the second and third slots, the NOTTO data show.

title: Girls outshine boys, secure top 3 positions in Punjab board Class 12 exams
content: A total of 2,65,388 students appeared for the exams, of whom 2,41,506 passed with an overall pass percentage of 91, according to the PSEB.

title: Man gets five years RI in red sanders case in Annamayya district
content: Case dates back to January 11, 2021, when police personnel from Valmikipuram intercepted a vehicle carrying three individuals, at Vittalam village on NH-71; other two accused died during the trial proceedings

title: Watch: Explained: What is the Pollachi sexual assault case all about?
content: The accused had enticed several women, sexually assaulted them, and filmed the acts to blackmail them

title: Plea at Madras High Court seeking stay on 12 laws taking away T.N. Governor’s power to appoint Vice-Chancellors
content: Justices G.R. Swaminathan and V. Lakshminarayanan of Madras High Court decide to consider the plea next week

title: Deputy Chairperson of Andhra Pradesh Legislative Council Mayana Zakia Khanam quits YSRCP, joins BJP
content: I have joined the BJP to convey a positive message from the Muslim minority community, she says, adding that Prime Minister Modi is ensuring equal rights for all

title: Legislator sparks row after forcibly securing release of detainee in elephant death case
content: In a video circulating on social media, MLA Janeesh Kumar accuses forest officials of attempting to frame innocent individuals by detaining them without following proper legal procedures

title: CPI (M) wants Centre to hold discussions with Maoists as positive atmosphere is prevailing
content: CM Revanth Reddy said recently that the Govt was prepared to constitute a peace committee to hold deliberations

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: M.P. HC orders immediate FIR against Minister Vijay Shah over remarks on Colonel Sofiya Qureshi
content: Taking suo motu cognisance of the controversial statement, the High Court's Division Bench of Justices Atul Shridharan and Anuradha Shukla ordered the police to register a first information report (FIR) against the Minister.

title: Pilot asks Centre to clarify stance on Trump's remarks about mediation between India, Pakistan
content: “Somewhere an attempt is being made to weigh India and Pakistan on the same scale once again, that is not a good sign for diplomacy, foreign policy and India’s future,” said Mr. Pilot

title: Install rear seat reminders, avoid dark window tints: Police issue advisory  after children died of suffocation in parked cars
content: As temperatures soar during the summer, the interior of a parked car can become a death trap within minutes

title: Delhi College urges students, staff to ‘follow Vice-Chancellor’ on X, withdraws notice later
content: The notice stated that members of the college community are "encouraged to retweet the posts shared through the platform" as a gesture of support and gratitude towards the country's defence forces

title: India’s homegrown ‘Bhargavastra’ counter swarm drone system test fired successfully
content: ‘Bhargavastra’ is a low-cost Counter Drone System with advanced capabilities for detecting and neutralising drone swarms effectively

title: Mere speculation: Chandrakant Patil on rumours about likely merger of NCP factions
content: The rumoured merger has never taken shape. It has always remained a matter of speculation. It's only a talking point, nothing has materialised, says BJP leader Chandrakant Patil

title: Andhra Pradesh Minister Nara Lokesh tells officials to create job opportunities on massive scale through skill development initiatives
content: Andhra Pradesh Minister Nara Lokesh directs APSSDC officials to focus on creating job opportunities in Andhra Pradesh; emphasises on infrastructure-linked skill training

title: President Murmu briefed on Operation Sindoor by CDS and service chiefs
content: Operation Sindoor, launched in retaliation for the Pahalgam terror attack, targets terror camps in Pakistan and PoK

title: Bescom to set up digital portal for consumer grievance redressal Bengaluru Karnataka
content: Upon the directions of the chairman of KERC, Bescom has constituted Consumer Grievance Redressal Forums at the district level comprising a Superintendent Engineer, Executive Engineer, and independent members

title: Bird flu scare in U.P.: Two more zoos shut, surveillance stepped up in poultry farms
content: The decision aims to prevent any possible transmission of the virus and to enhance surveillance across zoos and poultry farms. Chief Minister Adityanath stressed the need for urgent and coordinated action across departments.

title: Union Cabinet approves ₹3,706 crore HCL-Foxconn semiconductor joint venture; plant to be set up at Jewar
content: The proposed HCL-Foxconn semiconductor plant will manufacture display driver chips for mobile phones, laptops, automobiles, and other devices

title: A.P. Congress chief slams BJP Minister for his remarks on Col. Sofiya Qureshi
content: Y.S. Sharmila condemns BJP Minister’s sexist remarks against Indian Army officer; comments on BJP’s divisive mindset

title: ReNew Power to set up renewable energy complex in Andhra Pradesh’s Anantapur district
content: Andhra Pradesh IT & HRD Minister Nara Lokesh will be participating in the ceremony, thereby giving a big boost to the State’s RE landscape

title: Mangoes 2025: Tamil Nadu farmers on the season’s specialities
content: Now that peak mango season has arrived, farmers across Tamil Nadu give us a lowdown on varieties to look out for, sharing stories of survival against the odds

title: Transfer TASMAC FIRs to CBI, litigant urges Madras High Court
content: Justices G.R. Swaminathan and V. Lakshminarayanan order notices to the Tamil Nadu government, CBI, and ED

title: India-Pakistan ceasefire: Congress takes swipe at government over Donald Trump's remarks
content: The Indian National Congress questions if PM Modi and External Affairs Minister compromised India’s security interests under the U.S. pressure

title: West Bengal CM Mamata welcomes release of BSF jawan from Pakistan custody
content: Banerjee’s statement came amid celebrations at Mr. Shaw’s residence, where relatives, neighbours and well-wishers gathered with sweets to mark his safe return

title: Supreme Court requests panel to identify Agamic temples in Tamil Nadu
content: Once Agamic temples are identified, Tamil Nadu government can fill up archakar vacancies in non-Agamic temples. The court scheduled the next hearing in September 2025.
